name: Catoctin Mountain Park
description: President Franklin D. Roosevelt created programs to give people a chance to rebuild their lives from the Great Depression. The Works Progress Administration and the Civilian Conservation Corps gave this land a second opportunity and through re-growth, a new role as a recreation area.
shortDescription: President Franklin D. Roosevelt created programs to give people a chance to rebuild their lives from the Great Depression. The Works Progress Administration and the Civilian Conservation Corps gave th...

operatingHours.description: Hiking trails and parking areas are open year round, dawn to dusk, but may close as a result of security or safety concerns.  Consult the park's website for updates: http://www.nps.gov/cato/index.htm.  The visitor center, camps, and campgrounds have separate hours.  Please see descriptions for those facilities elsewhere.

climate.weatherDescription: Summer (June-Aug) average temperature is between 61 and 81 degrees Fahrenheit. Fall (Sep-Nov) average temperature is between 45 and 64 degrees Fahrenheit. Fall foliage is at its peak in mid-October Winter (Dec-Feb) average temperature is between 24 and 41 degrees Fahrenheit. Winter snowfall is between 5-12" per month. Spring (March-May) average temperature is between 41 and 63 degrees Fahrenheit. Average precipitation is approximately 4 inches per month. (Source: usclimatedata.com)

images.title: Chimney Rock Vista
images.altText: Rock formation with mountains in the background
images.caption: A challenging hike leads to Chimney Rock, the most popular vista in the park.

images.title: Visitor Center
images.altText: A stone and wood building with plants and flowers in front
images.caption: First time visitors should begin their park experience at the visitor center.

images.title: Eastern Mud Salamander
images.altText: A slender-bodied, red salamander with black spots across its body.
images.caption: Life is abundant at Catoctin Mountain Park, and habitat is plentiful for many salamander species.

images.title: Big Hunting Creek
images.altText: A fast flowing stream cutting through a green forest.
images.caption: Winding its way through the ridge, Big Hunting Creek is a popular fly fishing destination.

images.title: Historic Camp Misty Mount
images.altText: A log cabin in the woods
images.caption: Visitors can stay overnight in one of the historic Misty Mount cabins.

images.title: Wolf Rock
images.altText: A large angular boulder that resembles the shape of a wolf.
images.caption: At the end of a boulder field the size of a football field, stands Wolf Rock. Do you see the wolf?

images.title: Blue Ridge Summit
images.altText: A rocky outcrop nestled amongst trees overlooking a valley.
images.caption: Blue Ridge Summit offers hikers a view northward into Pennsylvania.

images.title: Sun Rays Through the Forest at Misty Mount
images.altText: Multiple bright sun rays shining through a forest with log cabins.
images.caption: Natural beauty envelopes the mountainside throughout the day.

images.title: The Horse Trail
images.altText: Two riders, on horseback, walking through a forested trail.
images.caption: The west side of the park is a popular trail riding destination.

images.title: Chimney Rock in the Fall
images.altText: A large rocky outcropping overlooking a mountainside with fall foliage.
images.caption: Chimney Rock provides an excellent view of the mountain's fall foliage.
